quoteFirst: All the torpedo tubes of the section were not empty, however, for Lieut. (jg) I. M. Kovar, in 137, at
quoteLast: , picked up an enemy formation at the southern end of the strait and attacked. quoteLast: the big bell clanged out a warning, dictionaries were shut, exercise-books handed in, pencil-boxes replaced in desks, and the class filed downstairs to the big schoolroom. quoteFirst: When we went into Bideford we met this ornament of the Sixth--is that decent enough?--hanging about on the road with a nasty look in his eye. We didn’t know _then_ why he was so anxious to stop us, _but_ at
quoteLast: , when we were in Yeo’s shop, we saw Tulke in broad daylight, _with_ his house-cap on, kissin’ an’ huggin’ a woman on the pavement. Is that decent enough for you?”

quoteFirst: “Saw a glare to the eastward, looking like a ship on fire, altered course at
quoteLast: to E.N.E. and ran down at full speed, twelve knots. Discovered the glare to be the whaleship _Eliza Adams_ of New Bedford trying out a whale. Resumed course immediately, S.80.W.

quoteLast: on the 21st we set out up the Vallon, passed for a time over pasture-land, and then over a stony waste, deeply channelled by watercourses. At 5.30 the two principal Aiguilles were well seen, and as, by this time, it was evident that the authors of the Sardinian official map had romanced as extensively in this neighbourhood as elsewhere, it was necessary to hold a council.
title: The Ascent of the Matterhorn
